title: Coiflet
summary: Coiflets are discrete wavelets designed by Ingrid Daubechies, at the request of Ronald Coifman, to have scaling functions with vanishing moments.  The wavelet is near symmetric, their wavelet functions have N / 3 {\displaystyle N/3} vanishing moments and scaling functions N / 3 − 1 {\displaystyle N/3-1} , and has been used in many applications using Calderón–Zygmund operators.[1][2]
